definitions: To prepare (oneself) for something difficult or unpleasant.
To make (something) stronger or more rigid by fitting a support.
To press one's body or part of one's body firmly against something in order to stop oneself from falling or to steady oneself.
To give a person renewed energy or vigor.
examples: She braced herself for the impact.
He braced the fence with a new post.
I braced my feet against the wall.
The cold water braced him up.
